snippet: Christine Lagarde and Angela Merkel, two of the most powerful women in the world, share a warmth and a chemistry rare among world leaders. But they also have dueling views about what needs to be done to prevent future Greek-like meltdowns from...
abstract: Christine Lagarde and Angela Merkel, two of the most powerful women in the world, share a warmth and a chemistry rare among world leaders. But they also have dueling views about what needs to be done to prevent future Greek-like meltdowns from spreading to other European economies.

headline.main: Close Friends on a Collision Course Over Europe
